mods.abstract: A RUNAWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 20th. instant, a runaway negro-boy, calling himself Alphonso, and says that he belongs to a certain Mr. Henry Peoples, residing in the town of New Iberia, in the Parish of St. Martins. Alphonso is five feet, four inches high, spare made, and speaking English only. The owner of said slave is requested to come forward, prove property pay charges, and take him awy, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas, April 23d, 1853.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
